intro: Lupinus ione-walkerae, commonly known as the Ione Walkerae lupine, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of California. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and clusters of blue to purple pea-like flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces cylindrical seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Lupinus ione-walkerae is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub and open woodlands.
